reasoning: Reporting incidence of new diagnoses. Global average ~2 per 100k, but varies dramatically from <0.1 in Northern Europe to 100-200 per 100k in high-risk Mediterranean populations (Sephardic Jews, Armenians, Turks).
source: Ozen S et al. (2009). Familial Mediterranean fever. Nat Rev Rheumatol. 5:10-16
